page.title: 19ESCOMB SAXON CHURCH
page.content: It is distinctive that the church has little History. It i a small, rather obscure, Church preserved by its lack of importance, yet a memorial to the hopes and aspirations of many generations. It was built at least as early as 675 AD with a nave about 43ft. by 14ft. with high side walls and a chancel 10ft. square, a plan unique to the NE. Much of the material used in its construction was salvaged from the Roman settlement at Vinovia. It has been restored three times, in about 667, 1897, and in 1964 when it was refurnished to be used for regular worship. The Victorian Church, that replaced it for a while, from 1863, was demolished in 1971. The Church suppurts a rare colony of tiny Whiskered Bats, the subject of a study by Durham Bat group.
